name: Angular-jekyll-editor
tagline: Angular based editor for jekyll based sites
body:
# Angular based editor for jekyll based sites

This is an angular based editor for [jekyll](http://jekyllrb.com/) based sites.
Its intended for use with sites hosted on github pages.
Github pages are awsome project but so less people can handle git and/or jekyll details.
They just want to be able to perform few basic operations without any technical knowledge.
This is goal of the angular-jekyll-editor.

## usage

After login process (use your github credentials, that has access to target repo) you get to dashboard.
It shows history of changes + some little info paragraps.
Use menu to navigate to desired manipulation views.

Angular-jekyll-editor lets you handle 3 basic things:

- pages: on page view you can see tree structure of pages along with handling buttons.
On right side there is preview (uses iframe, so what you see is live version).
By clicking on a page tree item you change url of the iframe so you see the appropriate page.
, add/edit pages and posts. TBD
- posts: posts are very similar to pages except they are not structured in tree.
They instead follow category/tag based structure.
That's why it is necessary to fill then when creating new posts.
- media files: And to upload/delete media files.
Just filebrowsing button and list of uploaded files (with delete button).
What to say more about? :)

## Installation and configuration

For details see [README.md](https://github.com/otevrenamesta/angular-jekyll-editor/blob/master/README.md).

Hope someone finds the angular-jekyll-editor handy.

Cheers!
